meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a clock in its regularity or precision.
meanings.sent1: Her movements were so clocklike, always precise and on time.
meanings.sent2: The clocklike ticking of the metronome helped her keep rhythm while playing the piano.
meanings.sent3: The clocklike behavior of the ants marching in a straight line fascinated the children.
meanings.sent4: His daily routine was as clocklike as the gears in a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The clocklike accuracy of the synchronized swimmers impressed the judges.

meanings.definition: Operating or functioning in a manner similar to a clock.
meanings.sent1: The clocklike mechanism of the old grandfather clock never failed to chime on the hour.
meanings.sent2: The clocklike precision of the train schedule ensured passengers arrived on time.
meanings.sent3: The clocklike rotation of the ceiling fan created a soothing breeze in the room.
meanings.sent4: The clocklike movements of the robotic arm in the factory increased efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The clocklike ticking of the bomb kept everyone on edge in the action movie.
